qas.question: What is the governing system of the Marshall Islands?
How old must a citizen of the Marshall Islands be to vote?
How often are elections held in the Marshall Islands?
What is the name of the Marshall Islands legislature?
When was the most recent constitution of the Marshall Islands adopted?

context: The government of the Marshall Islands operates under a mixed <a0_0>parliamentary-presidential system<a0_0/> as set forth in its Constitution. Elections are held <a2_0>every four years<a2_0/> in universal suffrage (for all citizens above <a1_0>18<a1_0/>), with each of the twenty-four constituencies (see below) electing one or more representatives (senators) to the lower house of RMI's unicameral legislature, the <a3_0>Nitijela<a3_0/>. (Majuro, the capital atoll, elects five senators.) The President, who is head of state as well as head of government, is elected by the 33 senators of the Nitijela. Four of the five Marshallese presidents who have been elected since the Constitution was adopted in <a4_0>1979<a4_0/> have been traditional paramount chiefs.
